Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of profile of male head (with dot in added red just above forehead) to right; behind his neck, undetermined blob with dot in added white; to right of head, part of undetermined black object; tondo marked off by three bands, alternating black and red tongues (with dilute dividing lines each ending in a white dot) and four bands; exterior: glazed save for band on lower wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "7" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 378, no. B526) (labelled 1912.37.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0402) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
